result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Georg Wiliiam Eugene Broadnax

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Georg Wiliiam Eugene Broadnax in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Georg Wiliiam Eugene Broadnax.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss COUNT 3 of amended complaint filed 9/2/2022. Court orders count 3 of the amended complaint DISMISSED. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 2nd, 2022

Defendant Georg Wiliiam Eugene Broadnax in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Georg Wiliiam Eugene Broadnax.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery but no offer. Amended complaint filed.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
to Amend Criminal Complaint, received and filed
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Georg Wiliiam Eugene Broadnax in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Georg Wiliiam Eugene Broadnax in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Georg Wiliiam Eugene Broadnax appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  AS TO COUNT 1; motion to dismiss by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause as to count 2.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
